name: Stephen E. Reichenbach
content: Stephen E. Reichenbach Stephen E. Reichenbach Professor Emeritus Computer Science & Engineering Dept. University of Nebraska–Lincoln Lincoln NE 68588-0115 voice: 1.402.472.2401 fax: 1.402.472.7767 email: reich@unl.edu Director GC Image, LLC PO Box 57403 Lincoln NE 68505-7403 voice: 1.402.310.4503 email: reich@gcimage.com Education Ph.D., Computer Science, William and Mary, Williamsburg VA (1989) M.S., Computer Science, Washington University, St. Louis MO (1985) B.A., English, University of Nebraska, Lincoln NE (1976) Distinctions Department Recognition Award, UNL CSE Department, 2018. Startup Company of the Year Award (GC Image), NUtech Ventures, 2017. [video] Founding Director and President, GC Image, LLC, 2002–2016. Innovation, Development and Engagement Award (IDEA), University of Nebraska, 2015. [video] Member, Nebraska Innovation Campus Faculty Advisory Committee, UNL, 2010–2012. Member, Board of Directors, Zoex Corporation, 2004–2012. Member, Technology Strategic Planning Committee, Lincoln Public Schools, 2012. Member, Strategic Planning Committee, Lincoln Public Schools, 2011. Co-Chair, Visual Information Processing XI – XX, Proceedings of the SPIE, 2002–2011. Visiting Professor, Manchester Interdisciplinary Biocentre, University of Manchester, 2007. Senator, Academic Senate, UNL, 2004–2007. Technology Professor of the Year, AIM Institute, 2005. Founding Director and President, Internet Nebraska Corporation, 1994–2005. Program Committee, SPIE Investigative Image Processing III, 2003. J.D. Edwards Professorship, UNL, 2002. Promoted to Professor of Computer Science and Engineering, UNL, 2001. Department Chair, Computer Science and Engineering Department, UNL, 1996–2000. Associate Editor, IEEE Transactions on Image Processing, 1996–98. Technical Program Committee, International Conference on Image Processing, 1997. CDROM Chair, Steering Committee, Technical Program Committee, International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium, 1993–1996. Promoted to Associate Professor of Computer Science and Engineering, UNL, 1996. ASEE Summer Faculty Fellowship, NASA Goddard Space Flight Center, 1995. Outstanding Researcher (Ass't Prof.), College of Engineering and Technology, UNL, 1994. George Holmes Research Fellowship, 1991. National Research Council Associateship, NASA Langley Research Center, 1989–90. Appointed Assistant Professor of Computer Science and Engineering, UNL, 1989. Current Research Interests Informatics and chemometrics for multi-dimensional chemical separations and three-dimensional mass-spectrometric imaging. Image restoration, resampling, and data fusion for infrared images and remotely sensed, multispectral data. Digital image processing algorithms and architectures that integrate restoration, compression, coding, and enhancement for optimal end-to-end performance subject to explicit implementation constraints. Scene modeling and artificial scene generation. Imaging system design, analysis, and simulation. Research methodology for digital image processing and computer vision. Visual information processing in multimedia systems, especially for web-based decision support. Journal and Book Publications S. Reichenbach. "GCxGC Data Visualization, Processing, and Analysis."
